title: Truffle 1.0 Windows 10 x64 "Not compatible with your operating system or architecture: fsevents@1.0.11"
body:
Truffle 1.0 isn't working for me on Windows 10 x64
`npm install -g truffle` returns:

``` bash
npm WARN deprecated graceful-fs@2.0.3: graceful-fs version 3 and before will fail on newer node releases. Please update to graceful-fs@^4.0.0 as soon as possible.
npm WARN deprecated npmconf@2.1.2: this package has been reintegrated into npm and is now out of date with respect to npm
npm WARN deprecated lodash@1.0.2: lodash@<3.0.0 is no longer maintained. Upgrade to lodash@^4.0.0.
npm WARN deprecated graceful-fs@1.2.3: graceful-fs version 3 and before will fail on newer node releases. Please update to graceful-fs@^4.0.0 as soon as possible.
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\J\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2: Cloning into 'C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2'...
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2: fatal: '/cygdrive/c/Users//AppData/Roaming/npm-cache/_git-remotes/git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1/C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1' does not appear to be a git repository
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2: fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2:
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\1\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2: Please make sure you have the correct access rights
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2: and the repository exists.
npm ERR! git clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2:
npm WARN optional Skipping failed optional dependency /truffle/chokidar/fsevents:
npm WARN notsup     
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10586
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install" "-g" "truffle"
npm ERR! node v5.1.0
npm ERR! npm  v3.8.5
npm ERR! code 128

npm ERR! Command failed: git -c core.longpaths=true clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2
npm ERR! Cloning into 'C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2'...
npm ERR! fatal: '/cygdrive/c/Users//AppData/Roaming/npm-cache/_git-remotes/git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1/C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1' does not appear to be a git repository
npm ERR! fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
```

``` bash
$npm -g install  fsevents
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10586
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "-g" "install" "fsevents"
npm ERR! node v5.1.0
npm ERR! npm  v3.8.5
npm ERR! code EBADPLATFORM

npm ERR! notsup Not compatible with your operating system or architecture: fsevents@1.0.11
npm ERR! notsup Valid OS:    darwin
npm ERR! notsup Valid Arch:  any
npm ERR! notsup Actual OS:   win32
npm ERR! notsup Actual Arch: x64
```

Note that the warnings about `fsevents` aren't the issue. Instead, it's having trouble reading from github:

```
npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10586
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install" "-g" "truffle"
npm ERR! node v5.1.0
npm ERR! npm  v3.8.5
npm ERR! code 128

npm ERR! Command failed: git -c core.longpaths=true clone C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1 C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2
npm ERR! Cloning into 'C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Temp\npm-3860-01924847\git-cache-f2055bfa\94d7146671b9719e00a09c29b01a691bc85048c2'...
npm ERR! fatal: '/cygdrive/c/Users//AppData/Roaming/npm-cache/_git-remotes/git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1/C:\Users\\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_git-remotes\git-https-github-com-debris-bignumber-js-git-master-df3f1ce1' does not appear to be a git repository
npm ERR! fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
```

You're on Windows so you don't want `fsevents` anyway.

I'm not sure what the reason is but I don't think this is a Truffle issue. I'm going to close for now as it seems like a networking error.
Which version of Node are you running?

Found the problem. Posting it if anyone else end up here from Google.

Git was both installed with cygwin and with setup.exe in windows. NPM used the cygwin-version in cmd, using both unix-paths and windows-paths together. Uninstalled cygwin, and it works. An other fix would be removing cygwin from path.
